items.title: Socceroos striker Martin Boyle in injury blow for Hibernian
items.summary: Martin Boyle, no stranger to the heartache of missing major tournaments with the Socceroos, was taken off after injuring his hamstring for Hibernian in the Scottish Premiership.

items.title: Kimberley homes lose roofs as emergency services respond to ex-Tropical Cyclone Hayley
items.summary: Emergency services travel to the Dampier Peninsula to assess the damage caused by the category three system, which crossed the coast on Tuesday afternoon.

items.title: 'White Australia' flyer letterbox drop in Newcastle sparks police investigation
items.summary: NSW Premier Chris Minns said police would "throw the book" at anyone behind flyers distributed to inner-city Newcastle letterboxes.

items.title: Ashes 2025: Alex Hartley responds to criticism for talking about period on BBC commentary
items.summary: Alex Hartley says she was stunned by the reaction to her talking about her period during the BBC's radio commentary of the third Ashes Test.

items.title: Promise of bumper coffee crop in 2026 fuelled by explosion of white flowers
items.summary: Australian coffee growers are hoping for a bumper 2026 season to meet increased demand for homegrown beans following a prolific flowering season.

items.title: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn in an induced coma with meningitis
items.summary: Former Australian Test and limited overs batsman Damien Martyn is in hospital in Queensland in an induced coma after falling ill this week.

items.summary: TV presenter and former builder Barry Du Bois is lobbying Canberra for change.

items.title: Broken Hill gardeners chop down trees in battle with Queensland fruit fly
items.summary: There was no fruit fly to be found in Broken Hill 20 years ago, but now gardeners are facing an uphill battle trying to rid themselves of the pest.

items.title: AI technology gives swimming pool lifeguards an extra set of eyes this summer
items.summary: An AI system used in 120 public pools across Australia analyses swimmers' movements and sends an alert to a lifeguard's smartwatch if it detects someone in trouble.

items.summary: New Year's Day brings a host of new laws, regulations and guidelines into effect. Here's a quick breakdown of some of the changes.

items.title: Flooding claims a life as deluge cuts north-west Queensland roads, isolates towns

items.title: Calls for tighter regulations after Woodside knowingly shed plastic into ocean

items.title: Record year for Australian beef exports despite Donald Trump's tariffs

items.title: Flocks of tourists dubbed the 'koala paparazzi' putting animals at risk in Byron Bay

items.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of John F Kennedy, dies aged 35
items.summary: Tatiana Schlossberg revealed in an essay published in November that she had a rare form of terminal leukaemia.

items.title: ASX ends 'stressful' year with gold and lithium stocks surging despite Trump's trade war threats
items.summary: Several gold, lithium and other mining stocks have seen their share price double, and even triple, in 2025 as Australia's share market has had a much better than expected year despite tariffs, economic uncertainty and Donald Trump's ongoing unpredictability.

items.title: Mechanic shortage driving Queensland businesses to look overseas for qualified workers
items.summary: The automotive repair industry says it is dealing with a major labour and skills shortage, and some mechanics are looking overseas for workers.

items.title: For many South Australians, 2025 could be summarised as the year of searching for answers

items.title: Robbers steal $52 million from vault of German savings bank
items.summary: According to police, the robbers drilled their way into the underground vault room of the savings bank from a parking garage.

items.title: Denmark becomes first country in world to end letter delivery

items.title: What should you do during a violent mass attack?

items.title: Human-operated Tokyo robot venture allows housebound people to work
items.summary: Ory Yoshifuji's Tokyo business employs housebound individuals to operate robots as waitstaff at a cafe and as personal tour guides in the city.

items.title: Sportsbet pressured key watchdog into 'watering down' enforcement announcement

items.title: Crowd-funding business campaigns falter, despite demand for tipple
items.summary: Brewer Richard Jeffares's Victorian company raised about $2.5 million from 993 investors in a matter of days through a method called crowd-sourced funding, also known as equity crowdfunding.

items.title: Kakadu traditional owner says nature has long warned us about rising sea levels
items.summary: In wet season, Jonathan and his family have to drive, boat and drive again if they want to reach town. The remote NT traditional owner says nature has long been warning us about climate change, "but nobody's listening".

items.title: Christmas cruise ends in chaos as Coral Adventurer passengers return home
items.summary: About 80 passengers on the Coral Adventurer are flown home after the cruise ship ran aground on a reef off Papua New Guinea.

items.title: South Korea bans bear bile farming with jail for those who breach the law
items.summary: South Korea is one of the few countries that allow farming to extract bile from bears, for traditional medicine or food believed to promote vitality and stamina.

items.summary: Police were called to a vehicle submerged in floodwaters near Normanton where they found the man aged in his 70s.

items.title: Australian people smuggling operation laid bare in NT Supreme Court

items.summary: This Australian animation stars an international and local voice cast led by Nick Offerman and Nina Oyama, who can't wait for children to see the film.

items.summary: More than 2,500 police officers will be out in force at New Year's Eve celebrations in Sydney in a bid to bolster revellers' confidence in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.summary: Despite becoming less popular in recent years, advocates like Maggie Beer say offal can be a delicacy.

items.title: NSW Parliament powerless to force witnesses to front inquiries after 19th-century laws struck down
items.summary: The president of the NSW Legislative Council says he will not try to overturn a decision to strike down laws that purportedly allowed witnesses to be arrested for failing to appear.

items.summary: Unlike his former bandmate John Lennon, George Harrison survived an attack by a fan, but the musician's friends and family speculated it hastened his death less than two years later.

items.title: Dozens of shark heads dumped outside WA Fisheries minister's office as demersal fishing ban looms
items.summary: Hundreds of kilograms of shark heads have been left dumped outside the WA Fisheries minister's office in Margaret River, just three days before a permanent commercial demersal fishing ban comes into effect.
